history.content:
If your only goal is to succeed in Data 100 and similar DS courses, I think CS88 would be fine. However, I would highly recommend taking 61A if you are at all interested in pursuing programming in any form beyond those DS courses. You will learn a lot more in 61A in general compared to CS88 and you will have a much deeper understanding of the concepts and patterns that are covered.

I'll just add that Data 100 strongly recommends 61A over 88 as a prerequisite, so even if you have no intention of taking more CS classes, I suggest you take 61A to help you In your goal of pursuing data science

If your only goal is to succeed in Data 100 and similar DS courses, I think CS88 would be fine. However, I would highly recommend taking 61A if you are at all interested in pursuing programming in any form beyond those DS courses. You will learn a lot more in 61A in general compared to CS88 and you will have a much deeper understanding of the concepts and patterns that are covered.

I am debating between CS 61A and CS 88 for the data science minor. In terms of computer science, my only experience is AP Computer Science in high school and Data 8. I would love to hear any recommendations between CS 61A and CS 88. My goal is to help me gain a solid programming foundation and help me succeed in Data 100; however, I do not anticipate to take additional CS classes such as 61B or 70.  

Thank you!
history.subject: CS 61A vs CS 88
